name: Architecture (B.S.)
description: The Bachelor of Science in Architecture at MIT provides a comprehensive education in the field, focusing on the intersection of design, technology, and culture. The program emphasizes the development of skills in design, visualization, and communication, as well as an understanding of the social, cultural, and environmental contexts of architecture. Students engage with a range of subjects, including design studios, building technology, history and theory, and visual studies.

name: Art and Design (B.S.)
description: The Department of Architecture offers an undergraduate program in Art and Design leading to a Bachelor of Science degree. The program is designed to provide students with a rigorous foundation in the principles of art and design, as well as the technical skills and knowledge necessary to pursue a career in the field. Students in the program take a range of courses in art and design, including studio classes, art history, and theory, as well as courses in other departments across MIT.

name: Planning (B.S.)
description: The Department of Urban Studies and Planning offers an undergraduate major in Planning. This program provides a broad education in the theory, methods, and practice of urban planning, preparing students for careers in urban and regional planning, public policy, and related fields.

name: Aerospace Engineering (B.S.)
description: The Department of Aeronautics and Astronautics offers a Bachelor of Science degree in Aerospace Engineering. The program provides a strong foundation in the aerodynamic and astronautic fundamentals of aerospace engineering, as well as the underlying mathematics, physics, and engineering principles. Students gain a broad understanding of aerospace engineering disciplines, with hands-on experience in design, testing, and project management.

name: Archaeology and Materials (B.S.)
description: The Department of Materials Science and Engineering's undergraduate program in Archaeology and Materials explores the application of materials science and engineering principles to the study of archaeological materials and cultural heritage. Students learn about the properties, processing, and performance of materials in ancient contexts, and develop skills in materials characterization, analysis, and conservation.

name: Biological Engineering (B.S.)
description: The Biological Engineering major is an interdisciplinary program that combines engineering principles with biological systems to develop innovative solutions to real-world problems. Students learn to apply engineering principles to understand and manipulate biological systems, from molecules to organisms. The program is designed to provide a strong foundation in mathematics, physics, and biology, as well as engineering principles and practices.

name: Chemical Biological Engineering (B.S.)
description: The Department of Chemical Engineering offers a program leading to the degree of Bachelor of Science in Chemical Engineering. The program is designed to provide a broad foundation in the principles of chemical engineering, including the application of these principles to solve problems in the field. Students learn about transport phenomena, thermodynamics, kinetics, and process control, as well as the application of these concepts to the design and operation of chemical processes. The program also includes coursework in biology, mathematics, and physics, and provides opportunities for hands-on learning through laboratory and design projects.

name: Chemical Engineering (B.S.)
description: The undergraduate program in Chemical Engineering provides a foundation in the fundamental principles of chemical engineering, including thermodynamics, transport phenomena, and reaction kinetics. Students learn to apply these principles to solve problems in a variety of areas, including energy, materials, and biotechnology. The program emphasizes the development of skills in problem-solving, communication, and teamwork.

name: Materials Science and Engineering (B.S.)
description: The undergraduate program in Materials Science and Engineering provides a foundation in the science and engineering of materials, including their structure, properties, and performance. Students develop an understanding of the relationships between materials' properties and their underlying structure, as well as the processing techniques used to produce materials with specific properties. The program prepares students for careers in a wide range of industries, including aerospace, energy, electronics, and biomedical, as well as for graduate study.

name: Mechanical and Ocean Engineering (B.S.)
description: The Mechanical and Ocean Engineering program at MIT is an interdisciplinary major that combines the fundamentals of mechanical engineering with the study of ocean engineering. Students in this program gain a broad foundation in mechanical engineering, including mechanics, thermodynamics, and materials science, while also exploring the specific challenges and opportunities of ocean engineering, such as offshore structures, ocean energy, and marine robotics.

name: Mechanical Engineering (B.S.)
description: The Department of Mechanical Engineering offers a challenging and comprehensive program that provides students with a foundation in the principles of mechanical engineering, including mechanics, thermodynamics, materials science, and mechanical design. The program includes a broad range of courses in mathematics, physics, and engineering, as well as a strong laboratory component. Students are prepared for careers in industry, research, and academia, as well as for graduate study.

name: Nuclear Science and Engineering (B.S.)
description: The Nuclear Science and Engineering Department at MIT offers a Bachelor of Science degree that provides a comprehensive education in the fundamental principles of nuclear science and engineering. The program includes coursework in nuclear physics, reactor physics, radiation protection, nuclear systems, and energy policy, as well as laboratory and research experiences. Students develop skills in problem-solving, analysis, and communication, preparing them for careers in industry, government, or further study.

name: Anthropology (B.S.)
college: School of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences
description: The Anthropology program at MIT is an interdisciplinary field that explores human diversity through culture, history, and biology. Students examine human societies, behaviors, and the impact of global processes. The major prepares students for diverse careers or further study by developing critical thinking, research, and analytical skills.

name: Comparative Media Studies (B.S.)
college: School of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences
description: The Comparative Media Studies/ Writing major is an interdisciplinary program that combines theoretical and practical approaches to understanding media and culture. Students explore the history, theory, and aesthetics of various media forms, and engage in hands-on creative work. The program emphasizes the development of critical thinking, writing, and production skills.

name: Economics (B.S.)
college: School of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences
description: The Department of Economics offers a major in Economics, which provides a rigorous education in economic theory, econometrics, and applied economics. Students develop a strong foundation in microeconomics, macroeconomics, and econometrics, as well as a range of elective courses in specialized areas. The program prepares students for a variety of careers in government, business, finance, and academia, as well as for graduate study in economics and related fields.

name: Global Studies and Languages (B.S.)
college: School of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences
description: The Global Studies and Languages (GSL) major is an interdisciplinary program that allows students to explore global issues from multiple disciplinary perspectives and focuses on gaining skills in a foreign language. GSL majors take courses in the humanities, social sciences, and languages and investigate global phenomena through a range of lenses, producing a nuanced understanding of cultural and societal processes.

name: History (B.S.)
college: School of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences
description: The History Section at MIT offers a rigorous program that enables students to understand the past in all its complexity. Majors acquire skills in critical reading, argumentation, and historical interpretation, and develop a nuanced understanding of the ways in which historical narratives shape our understanding of the present and future.

name: Humanities (B.S.)
college: School of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences
description: The Department of Humanities provides a rigorous education in the humanities with an emphasis on literature, history, philosophy, and cultural studies. Students explore a range of subjects, developing their critical thinking, writing, and analytical skills. The program allows students to pursue their interests while providing a solid foundation for various careers or further study.

name: Humanities and Engineering (B.S.)
college: School of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences
description: The program in Humanities and Engineering is designed for students who wish to combine the study of engineering with study in the humanities. The program leads to a Bachelor of Science degree. Students in this program develop a strong foundation in engineering, as well as a deep understanding of the humanities. The program is designed to be completed in four years.

name: Humanities and Science (B.S.)
college: School of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences
description: The Humanities and Science major is designed for students who wish to combine a serious interest in a Humanities or Social Science field with a concentration in a Science field. Students in the major integrate knowledge and methods from both fields.

name: Linguistics and Philosophy (B.S.)
college: School of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences
description: The Linguistics and Philosophy program is an interdisciplinary major that combines the study of language and the study of fundamental philosophical questions. Students in this program explore the structure and semantics of language, as well as the principles of reasoning and inference. The program prepares students for graduate study in linguistics, philosophy, or related fields, and for careers in areas such as law, education, and research.

name: Literature (B.S.)
college: School of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences
description: The Literature major at MIT is designed for students who wish to pursue a deep understanding of literature in English, with a focus on critical thinking, close reading, and effective writing. The program encompasses a broad range of literary periods, genres, and theoretical approaches, preparing students for a variety of careers or further academic study.

name: Mathematical Economics (B.S.)
college: School of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences
description: The Mathematical Economics major is designed for students who wish to combine the study of economics and mathematics. It provides a strong foundation in both fields, preparing students for graduate study or careers in government, finance, or research. The program includes coursework in microeconomics, macroeconomics, econometrics, and mathematical economics, as well as advanced mathematics courses.

name: Music (B.S.)
college: School of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences
description: The Music program at MIT is designed for students who wish to pursue a deep understanding of music within the context of a science and engineering education. The curriculum covers a broad range of musical topics, from the physics of sound and music theory to the cultural and historical contexts of music. Students engage in performance, composition, and analysis, developing their skills as musicians and music scholars.

name: Philosophy (B.S.)
college: School of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences
description: The Department of Linguistics and Philosophy offers a major in Philosophy that exposes students to the major subfields of philosophy, including metaphysics and epistemology, ethics, logic, and the history of philosophy. Students develop critical thinking, writing, and analytical skills, preparing them for a range of careers or graduate study.

name: Political Science (B.S.)
college: School of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences
description: The Political Science major at MIT is designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the discipline, covering topics such as political theory, international relations, comparative politics, and American politics. The program emphasizes theoretical and empirical approaches, preparing students for a range of careers in government, law, academia, and other fields.

name: Science, Technology, and Society (Second Major) (B.S.)
college: School of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences
description: The STS major is an interdisciplinary program designed for students who wish to understand the social, political, and cultural dimensions of science and technology. The STS curriculum includes a foundation in the social sciences and humanities, as well as a range of electives that allow students to explore specific topics in depth.

name: Theater Arts (B.S.)
college: School of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences
description: The Theater Arts program at MIT is an interdisciplinary course of study that combines the study of theater and performance with the rigorous analysis and critical thinking of the liberal arts. Students explore the history, theory, and practice of theater, developing skills in performance, directing, playwriting, and design. The program emphasizes the connections between theater and other disciplines, including literature, history, and culture.

name: Writing (B.S.)
college: School of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences
description: The Writing major at MIT is an undergraduate program that focuses on the art and craft of writing. Students develop their skills in creative writing, technical writing, and other forms of writing. The program emphasizes the importance of language, literature, and culture in understanding the world.

name: Business Analytics (B.S.)
description: The Business Analytics program at MIT is an interdisciplinary major that combines coursework in economics, data analytics, management, and finance to equip students with skills to analyze complex business problems and develop data-driven solutions. The program focuses on understanding business operations, identifying opportunities for improvement, and applying analytical methods to drive decision-making.

name: Finance (B.S.)
description: The Finance major is designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the financial system, financial markets, and financial instruments. The program covers the theoretical foundations of finance, as well as practical applications in areas such as investments, corporate finance, and financial institutions. Students learn to analyze financial data, manage risk, and make informed investment decisions.

name: Management (B.S.)
description: The undergraduate major in Management at MIT is designed to equip students with a deep understanding of how organizations function, the principles of management, and the dynamics of global economies. The program emphasizes analytical and quantitative approaches to management, including the study of organizational behavior, economic principles, and decision-making processes. Through a combination of core courses and electives, students gain the knowledge and skills necessary to navigate complex business environments and lead effectively in a rapidly changing world.

name: Biology (B.S.)
description: The Department of Biology offers a Bachelor of Science degree in Biology, providing a foundation in the biological sciences. The program includes core subjects in genetics, biochemistry, molecular biology, and cell biology, as well as laboratory and research experiences. Students can choose from a variety of electives to explore different areas of biology in depth.

name: Brain and Cognitive Sciences (B.S.)
description: The Department of Brain and Cognitive Sciences is devoted to understanding the mind and brain through a multidisciplinary approach, incorporating perspectives from psychology, neuroscience, computer science, and other related fields. The undergraduate major in Brain and Cognitive Sciences provides a foundation for a range of careers or graduate study by providing a comprehensive education in the cognitive sciences and neurosciences. Coursework includes molecular and cellular neuroscience, neuroanatomy, systems neuroscience, and cognitive science. Students develop laboratory, computational, and quantitative skills necessary for understanding the brain and cognitive processes.

name: Chemistry (B.S.)
description: The Department of Chemistry offers a program leading to the degree of Bachelor of Science in Chemistry. The program is designed to give students a thorough understanding of the principles of chemistry and to provide a foundation for further study or for professional work in chemistry or related fields. The program includes a core of required courses in chemistry, physics, and mathematics, as well as a selection of advanced courses in chemistry and related fields.

name: Earth, Atmospheric, and Planetary Sciences (B.S.)
description: The Department of Earth, Atmospheric, and Planetary Sciences offers a program leading to a Bachelor of Science degree. The program provides a broad foundation in the fundamental principles of earth sciences, including the study of the Earth's lithosphere, hydrosphere, atmosphere, and biosphere, as well as the planets. Students develop an understanding of the complex interactions between these components and the processes that shape our planet.

name: Mathematics (B.S.)
description: The Department of Mathematics offers a program of study leading to the Bachelor of Science degree. The curriculum provides a foundation in the main areas of mathematics and is designed for students who want a thorough grounding in the field.

name: Mathematics with Computer Science (B.S.)
description: The Mathematics with Computer Science program is an interdisciplinary major that provides a foundation in mathematical theory and computational principles. Students explore the intersection of mathematics and computer science through coursework in mathematical analysis, algorithms, and computational theory. The program prepares students for careers that require a deep understanding of both mathematical and computational concepts.

name: Physics (B.S.)
description: The Physics Department offers a program leading to a Bachelor of Science degree in Physics. The program includes a core curriculum in classical mechanics, electromagnetism, quantum mechanics, and statistical mechanics, as well as advanced courses in specialized areas. Students are encouraged to participate in research projects and engage with the department's faculty.

name: Computer Science and Engineering (B.S.)
description: This program provides a foundation in the fundamental concepts of computer science and engineering, including the design, development, and testing of computer systems and algorithms. Students take a range of courses in computer science, mathematics, and engineering, and have the opportunity to pursue advanced topics and electives in areas such as artificial intelligence, data science, and computer networks.

name: Artificial Intelligence and Decision Making (B.S.)
description: The Artificial Intelligence and Decision-Making major at MIT focuses on developing computational models, algorithms, and systems that enable machines to perceive, reason, and act intelligently. The program integrates coursework in artificial intelligence, decision theory, machine learning, and data science, preparing students to tackle complex problems and make informed decisions. Students explore the foundational principles and methodologies in AI, learn to apply AI techniques to real-world challenges, and develop a nuanced understanding of the societal implications of AI and decision-making systems.

name: Electrical Engineering with Computing (B.S.)
description: The Electrical Engineering with Computing major at MIT is designed to provide a broad foundation in electrical engineering and computer science. The program includes core courses in circuits, electronics, signals and systems, and computing, as well as a range of electives and advanced courses. Students develop problem-solving skills, both theoretical and practical, and are prepared for a wide range of careers in industry, research, and academia.

name: Chemistry and Biology (B.S.)
description: The Chemistry and Biology major is designed for students who are interested in the overlap between the disciplines of Chemistry and Biology. This major provides a foundation in the core principles of both fields, with an emphasis on the chemical aspects of biological systems. Students take courses in inorganic and organic chemistry, biochemistry, and biology, as well as physics and mathematics.

name: Climate System Science and Engineering (B.S.)
description: The Climate System Science and Engineering major is an interdisciplinary program that focuses on the complex interactions within the Earth's climate system. It combines coursework from the departments of Earth, Atmospheric and Planetary Sciences and Civil and Environmental Engineering to provide a comprehensive understanding of climate dynamics, impacts, and potential solutions. Students in this major explore the science behind climate change, its effects on the environment and society, and the engineering approaches to mitigate and adapt to these changes.

name: Computation and Cognition (B.S.)
description: The Computation and Cognition program is an interdisciplinary major that combines computer science, cognitive science, and neuroscience to understand the computational principles underlying human cognition and to develop new computational models and systems inspired by the human brain. The program covers the fundamentals of computer science, cognitive science, and neuroscience, as well as the intersections between them.

name: Computer Science and Molecular Biology (B.S.)
description: This major combines the study of computer science and molecular biology, providing a foundation in the principles of computer science and the study of molecular biology. The program includes coursework in algorithms, data structures, computer architecture, and software engineering, as well as molecular biology, biochemistry, and genetics.

name: Computer Science, Economics, and Data Science (B.S.)
college: School of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences
description: This program combines the fundamentals of computer science, economics, and data science to provide a comprehensive understanding of the field. Students learn to analyze complex systems, develop algorithms, and apply data-driven insights to real-world problems. The curriculum includes coursework in programming, data structures, algorithms, microeconomics, macroeconomics, and statistical modeling.

name: Urban Science and Planning with Computer Science (B.S.)
description: The Urban Science and Planning with Computer Science major combines the fields of urban planning and computer science. Students learn to apply computational methods to analyze and address urban challenges. The program focuses on developing skills in data analysis, software development, and urban planning principles.
